title: IDEA NO. 321 : Works of Jan Tschichold
content:
Hello Typophile amigos, I recently completed a basic Dreamweaver website in honor of Jan Tschichold. And in my quest for knowledge I found the ever so awesome Japanese magazine IDEA did a whole issue on Jan Tschichold it was actually, IDEA NO. 321 : Works of Jan Tschichold. If I wanted to order this from Japan I’m looking at $67. Does anyone know where I can pick up this issue in the states? I live in Las Vegas so my outlets here are pretty nill. S-O-S!

 [‹ Help with .OTF font in Flash](http://web.archive.org/web/20080515214758/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34316 "Go to previous forum topic") [3D fonts-Fonts made from Objects ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080515214758/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28738 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Checko Salgado

comments.content:
A bookstore in LA’s Little Tokyo has it.

hhp

Yup! Couldn’t remember the name, sorry. :-/  
My Japanese is limited to things like “hamachi toro sashimi”. Yummm.

hhp
Your awesome. Thanks any hoot. Arigato ugozaimasu.
Where can we see the website on Tschichold?

Please consider I am still in the crawling stages of Dreamweaver. But you can see the site @: [http://checkofoto.com/tschi\_sites/tschicholdindex.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080515214758/http:/checkofoto.com/tschi_sites/tschicholdindex.html "http://checkofoto.com/tschi\_sites/tschicholdindex.html") . Most of my class had no idea whom Señor Tschichold was so this was more or less a primer to hopefully gain interest not only in Tschichold but also in typography. I also did a Flash site in honor of Paul Renner. that one should be up before typecon. Comments are cool. Ciao, √0
